Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

TestField.cxx

33 #include <sstream>

35 using std::stringstream;
36 
37 using namespace Kassiopeia;
38 using namespace katrin;
39 
40 int main( int anArgc, char** anArgv )
41 {
42  // read in xml file
43  KXMLTokenizer tXMLTokenizer;
44  KVariableProcessor tVariableProcessor;
45  KFormulaProcessor tFormulaProcessor;
46  KIncludeProcessor tIncludeProcessor;
47  KLoopProcessor tLoopProcessor;
48  KConditionProcessor tConditionProcessor;
49  KTagProcessor tTagProcessor;
50  KElementProcessor tElementProcessor;
51 
52  tVariableProcessor.InsertAfter( &tXMLTokenizer );
53  tFormulaProcessor.InsertAfter( &tVariableProcessor );
54  tIncludeProcessor.InsertAfter( &tFormulaProcessor );
55  tLoopProcessor.InsertAfter( &tIncludeProcessor );
56  tConditionProcessor.InsertAfter( &tLoopProcessor );
57  tTagProcessor.InsertAfter( &tConditionProcessor );
58  tElementProcessor.InsertAfter( &tTagProcessor );
59 
60  KTextFile tInputFile;
61  tInputFile.AddToBases( "TestField.xml" );
62  tInputFile.AddToPaths( string( CONFIG_DEFAULT_DIR ) + string( "/Validation" ) );
63  tXMLTokenizer.ProcessFile( &tInputFile );
64 
65  // read in command line parameters
66  if( anArgc <= 1 )
67  {
68  mainmsg( eWarning ) << ret;
69  mainmsg << "usage:" << ret;
70  mainmsg << "TestField <field_component>" << ret;
71  mainmsg << ret;
72  mainmsg << "available field components found in " << CONFIG_DEFAULT_DIR << "/Validation/TestField.xml" << ret;
73  mainmsg << eom;
74  return -1;
75  }
76 
77  string tPath( anArgv[ 1 ] );
78 
79  unsigned int tCount = 100;
80 
81  // initialize magnetic field
82  KSMagneticField* tRootMagneticField = getMagneticField( tPath );
83 
84  if (tRootMagneticField)
85  {
86  tRootMagneticField->Initialize();
87  tRootMagneticField->Activate();
88  }
89 
90  // initialize electric field
91  KSElectricField* tRootElectricField = getElectricField( tPath );
92 
93  if (tRootElectricField)
94  {
95  tRootElectricField->Initialize();
96  tRootElectricField->Activate();
97  }
98 
99  KThreeVector tPoint,tMagneticPotential,tElectricField,tMagneticField;
100  double tElectricPotential;
101  KThreeMatrix tMagneticGradient;
102 
103  for (unsigned int i=0;i<tCount;i++)
104  {
105  tPoint[0] = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform(-10.,10.);
106  tPoint[1] = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform(-10.,10.);
107  tPoint[2] = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform(-10.,10.);
108 
109  if (tRootMagneticField)
110  {
111  tRootMagneticField->CalculatePotential(tPoint,0,tMagneticPotential);
112  tRootMagneticField->CalculateField(tPoint,0,tMagneticField);
113  tRootMagneticField->CalculateGradient(tPoint,0,tMagneticGradient);
114  }
115 
116  if (tRootElectricField)
117  {
118  tRootElectricField->CalculatePotential(tPoint,0,tElectricPotential);
119  tRootElectricField->CalculateField(tPoint,0,tElectricField);
120  }
121 
122  std::cout<<"Point: "<<tPoint<<std::endl;
123  if (tRootMagneticField)
124  {
125  std::cout<<" Magnetic Potential: "<<tMagneticPotential<<std::endl;
126  std::cout<<" Magnetic Field: "<<tMagneticField<<std::endl;
127  std::cout<<" Magnetic Gradient: "<<tMagneticGradient<<std::endl;
128  }
129  if (tRootElectricField)
130  {
131  std::cout<<" Electric Potential: "<<tElectricPotential<<std::endl;
132  std::cout<<" Electric Field: "<<tElectricField<<std::endl;
133  }
134  }
135 
136  if (tRootElectricField)
137  {
138  double z1 = -7.e-3;
139  double z2 = 7.e-3;
140  double x1 = 0.;
141  double x2 = 1.e-2;
142 
143  double dx = 1.e-4;
144  double dz = 1.e-4;
145 
146  KEMField::KEMFieldCanvas* fieldCanvas = NULL;
147 
148  // fieldCanvas = new KEMField::KEMRootFieldCanvas(z1,z2,x1,x2,1.e30,true);
149  fieldCanvas = new KEMField::KEMVTKFieldCanvas(z1,z2,x1,x2,1.e30,true);
150 
151  if (fieldCanvas)
152  {
153  int N_x = (int)((x2-x1)/dx);
154  int N_z = (int)((z2-z1)/dz);
155 
156  int counter = 0;
157  int countermax = N_z*N_x;
158 
159  std::vector<double> x_;
160  std::vector<double> y_;
161  std::vector<double> V_;
162 
163  double spacing[2] = {dz,dx};
164 
165  double phi = 0.;
166 
167  std::cout<<"Computing potential field on a "<<N_x<<" by "<<N_z<<" grid"<<std::endl;
168 
169  for (int g=0;g<N_z;g++)
170  x_.push_back(z1+g*spacing[0]+spacing[0]/2);
171 
172  for (int h=0;h<N_x;h++)
173  y_.push_back(x1+h*spacing[1]+spacing[1]/2);
174 
175  for (int g=0;g<N_z;g++)
176  {
177  for (int h=0;h<N_x;h++)
178  {
179  double P[3] = {y_[h],0.,x_[g]};
180 
181  tRootElectricField->CalculatePotential(P,0,phi);
182 
183  counter++;
184  if (counter*100%countermax==0)
185  {
186  std::cout<<"\r";
187  std::cout<<int((float)counter/countermax*100)<<" %";
188  std::cout.flush();
189  }
190 
191  V_.push_back(phi);
192  }
193  }
194  std::cout<<"\r";
195  std::cout.flush();
196 
197  fieldCanvas->DrawFieldMap(x_,y_,V_,false,.5);
198  fieldCanvas->LabelAxes("z (m)","r (m)","#Phi (V)");
199  fieldCanvas->SaveAs("VFieldMap_rz.gif");
200  }
201  }
202

209 TH1D tMagneticFieldYHistogram( "magnetic_field_y_histogram", "magnetic_field_y_histogram", 600,0.,6.);
210 TH1D tMagneticFieldZHistogram( "magnetic_field_z_histogram", "magnetic_field_z_histogram", 600,0.,6.);
211 
212 
213

215 tMagneticFieldCanvas.cd( 0 );
216 tMagneticFieldXHistogram.SetFillColor( kBlue );
217 tMagneticFieldXHistogram.SetTitle( "Magnetic Field X" );

232 
233 // deinitialize magnetic field
234 if (tRootMagneticField)
235  {
236  tRootMagneticField->Deactivate();
237  tRootMagneticField->Deinitialize();
238  }
239 
240 // deinitialize electric field
241 if (tRootElectricField)
242  {
243  tRootElectricField->Deactivate();
244  tRootElectricField->Deinitialize();
245  }
246 
247 
248 return 0;
249 }
